text: Damn it!  I wanted a Last Apprentice movie not a Seventh Son movie.  Now I probably have to wait 10+ more years until this movie cools off because they took the characters names, Tom Ward the Apprentice, Gregory the Spook, and Alice the Witch. The series was so good and there was enough action and horror in every book in the series that they could have made a decent movie per book.  But this looks like they read the backs of two of the books and made a movie about that.  legendary is a good movie company but they should have taken more care when they base movies of books like they did with 300.  Also, Jeff Bridges is a good actor, but in my opinion, he has been having a hard time with movies in the past years (R.I.P.D., TRON Legacy, The Giver).  So I guess I will just wait for the reviews and hope that it is not absolutely different from the books.

text: This is not a film adaptation of your beloved book my friends.  Its kinda like what they do with comic books.  Think of this not as a adaptation but more of a different universe.  Let us judge this movie as something that stands on its own instead of something threaded to the original work.  I think Hollywood recognizes that they can't complete with the original content in its original form and basically uses the story and the characters at its core, creates fan fiction and hopes you will like what they have done as a separate entity.   There is no way they can do an adaptation for most of the books we love accurately and keep it under 2 hours and who is really gonna sit for days to watch one accurate movie. furthermore the parts you might find important and should be highlighted might not be what others find important, In conclusion you can't please all the people all the time.  The main target for this book is not the person who has read these books, because they know they can't  please you at all.  It is the person who might like the story and action, who if they do a good enough "introduction" might just pick up the books later.  I personally use the movies to determine the next books I will read

text: Given the history of Republicans and science I will be more then charitable in saying that this is not a wide spread republican stance but Rand going full tilt for his dad"s kooky crowd.  But you ask why is Chris Christie, Michelle Bachman and by all indication Ben Carson playing to this crowd ( and for now that will remain a conundrum for the ages). After all some should know better they are docters you say but Ben Carson, Bobby Jindel, and Rand Paul have all swallowed their book lernin' for the momentary adulation of the repulican anti-science, anti-govement, platform. The only question is how much red meat will they throw to belie this rabid crowd, before the point of no return.                       Infact what is the platform between Cliven Bundy Standoffs and Travon Martin, Micheal Brown killings between Science and Pappi's Earth bound wisdom,  treasonus corperation and trillionaires and multinationalist trying to buy an election, where do they stand? Where do they stand on a War with the ISIS, after the manufactured facts that got us into a quagmire in Iraq and burned into the American psyche as a ready to be forgotten episode, this congress and this GOP, stands ready to let Obama twist in the wind ready to critisize him on both fronts on the newest incarnation of Middle East barbary, and butchery. How will there Anything But Obama stance serve them after Obama has left the building?
